# Program Overview

The BYU Associate Product Manager (APM) Internships are for-credit, apprenticeship-style internships designed for high-performing undergraduate students majoring in Strategic Management at Brigham Young University.

Students work on real product and product-adjacent initiatives at company partners while earning academic credit toward their degree.

[**Request an Intern →**](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdBkPGjYG-r-lFm8OFNOX_5ObOlJk23fbLxHwEotaW6vINzDg/viewform?usp=header)

## Internship Structure

| Component | Details |
|-----------|---------|
| **Duration** | 4 months |
| **Period** | January 7 – April 15, 2026 |
| **Standard Hours** | 10 hours per week |
| **Extended Option** | Up to 20 hours per week |
| **Location** | In-person or remote, depending on company needs |

## Academic Credit

Students are enrolled in **STRAT 477R – Associate Product Manager Lab**

| Enrollment | Hours/Week | Credit Hours |
|------------|------------|--------------|
| Standard | 10 hours | 3.0 credits |
| Extended | Up to 20 hours | 6.0 credits |

## Compensation

- Internships are **unpaid** for hours associated with academic credit
- Companies may optionally offer compensation for hours worked beyond the credit-bearing requirement
- Compensation is optional and not required as part of the program

## Onboarding & Start

- Companies may reach out to interns directly to begin onboarding
- Early onboarding is encouraged so interns can hit the ground running
- The **official start date** when companies can expect the full 10 hours/week commitment is **January 7, 2026**

## Optional Extensions

- Companies may choose to offer paid summer extensions following the academic term
- Extensions are optional and not required as part of the program

## Roles & Contributions

Students support teams in product management, AI product building, and product-adjacent roles, contributing to:

- Product discovery and customer research
- Feature definition and prioritization
- Prototyping and experimentation
- Analytics, insights, and execution support
